channel.title: cryptocurrency exchange on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in cryptocurrency exchange on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bitbank Logo bitbank is one of the cryptocurrency exchanges in Japan. It is run by bitbank, Inc with its headquarter in Tokyo, Japan. The exchange primarily offers cryptocurrency spot trading on the order book as well as instant buy/sell and lending services. In September of 2017, the firm was officially licensed by the Financial Services Agency of Japan as a registered cryptocurrency exchange operator. Source
You can download theBitbanklogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bitbank
item.description: bitbank is one of the cryptocurrency exchanges in Japan. It is run by bitbank, Inc with its headquarter in Tokyo, Japan. The exchange primarily offers cryptocurrency spot trading on the order book as well as instant buy/sell and lending services. In September of 2017, the firm was officially licensed by the Financial Services Agency of Japan as a registered cryptocurrency exchange operator. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bitkub Logo
Bitkub is a Thailand-based cryptocurrency exchange, operated by Bitkub Online Co., Ltd. under its parent group Bitkub Capital Group Holdings. It was founded in 2018 by Jirayut Srupsrisopa, and was among the first exchanges to receive an operating licence, in 2019. It quickly grew to become the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the country, commanding a market share of over 90 percent in 2021. In November 2021, Siam Commercial Bank Group announced an acquisition deal in which it would acquire a 51 percent stake in the company for 17.
You can download theBitkublogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bitkub
item.description: Bitkub is a Thailand-based cryptocurrency exchange, operated by Bitkub Online Co., Ltd. under its parent group Bitkub Capital Group Holdings. It was founded in 2018 by Jirayut Srupsrisopa, and was among the first exchanges to receive an operating licence, in 2019. It quickly grew to become the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the country, commanding a market share of over 90 percent in 2021. In November 2021, Siam Commercial Bank Group announced an acquisition deal in which it would acquire a 51 percent stake in the company for 17.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bitso Logo Bitso is a Mexican cryptocurrency exchange based in Mexico. It was founded in 2014 by Ben Peters and Pablo Gonzalez. Daniel Vogel is the current chief executive officer. Source
You can download theBitsologo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bitso
item.description: Bitso is a Mexican cryptocurrency exchange based in Mexico. It was founded in 2014 by Ben Peters and Pablo Gonzalez. Daniel Vogel is the current chief executive officer. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bitstamp Logo
Bitstamp is a cryptocurrency exchange based in Luxembourg. It allows trading between fiat currency, bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. It allows USD, EUR, GBP, bitcoin, ALGO, XRP, Ether, litecoin, bitcoin cash, XLM, Link, OMG Network, USD Coin or PAX deposits and withdrawals. The company was founded as a European-focused alternative to then-dominant bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox. While the company trades in US dollars, it accepts fiat money deposits for free only via the European Union’s Single Euro Payments Area, a mechanism for transferring money between European bank accounts.
You can download theBitstamplogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bitstamp
item.description: Bitstamp is a cryptocurrency exchange based in Luxembourg. It allows trading between fiat currency, bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. It allows USD, EUR, GBP, bitcoin, ALGO, XRP, Ether, litecoin, bitcoin cash, XLM, Link, OMG Network, USD Coin or PAX deposits and withdrawals. The company was founded as a European-focused alternative to then-dominant bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox. While the company trades in US dollars, it accepts fiat money deposits for free only via the European Union’s Single Euro Payments Area, a mechanism for transferring money between European bank accounts.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Blockchain.com Logo Blockchain.com is a cryptocurrency financial services company. The company began as the first Bitcoin blockchain explorer in 2011 and later created a cryptocurrency wallet that accounted for 28% of bitcoin transactions between 2012 and 2020. It also operates a cryptocurrency exchange and provides institutional markets lending business and data, charts, and analytics. Source
You can download theBlockchainlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Blockchain.com is a cryptocurrency financial services company. item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
BTC Markets Logo BTC Markets is a large cryptocurrency exchange based in Melbourne, Australia. BTC Markets accepts Australian dollars, Litecoin, and Bitcoin in exchange for Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, Ethereum Classic, and Ripple. BTC Markets uses various security measures, including know your customer procedures and two-factor authentication. Source
You can download theBTC Marketslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: BTC Markets
item.description: BTC Markets is a large cryptocurrency exchange based in Melbourne, Australia. BTC Markets accepts Australian dollars, Litecoin, and Bitcoin in exchange for Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, Ethereum Classic, and Ripple. BTC Markets uses various security measures, including know your customer procedures and two-factor authentication. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bitfinex Logo
Bitfinex is a Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange owned and operated by iFinex Inc., which is headquartered in Hong Kong and registered in the British Virgin Islands. Their customers' money has been stolen or lost in several incidents, and they have been unable to secure normal banking relationships. Research suggests that price manipulation of bitcoin on Bitfinex accounted for about half of the price increase of bitcoin in late 2017. According to a 2019 statement by Bitfinex prior to the offering of US$1 billion in tokens, Bitfinex had a net profit of US$404 million in 2018.
You can download theBitfinexlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bitfinex
item.description: Bitfinex is a Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange owned and operated by iFinex Inc., which is headquartered in Hong Kong and registered in the British Virgin Islands. Their customers' money has been stolen or lost in several incidents, and they have been unable to secure normal banking relationships. Research suggests that price manipulation of bitcoin on Bitfinex accounted for about half of the price increase of bitcoin in late 2017. According to a 2019 statement by Bitfinex prior to the offering of US$1 billion in tokens, Bitfinex had a net profit of US$404 million in 2018.
